definition:
Suppose we have an algebraic number such that the polynomial of smallest
degree it is a root of (with the co-efficients relatively prime) is
given by:

$$\sum_{i=0}^n a_i x^i .$$

Then the height $h$ of the algebraic number is given by:

$$h = n + \sum_{i=0}^n |a_i| .$$

This is a quantity which is used in the proof of the existence of
transcendental numbers.

Chester, 2003. Stewart, I. Galois Theory, 3rd edition. Chapman and Hall,
2003. Baker, A. Transcendental Number Theory, 1st edition. Cambridge
University Press, 1975.
